result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Maurice L Hoard in court with attorney Katie Lynn Gutowski.  Rebecca L Sommers appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
The State has filed an amended information. Defense acknowledges receipt and waives reading of same; NG plea entered. Upon plea to charge in amended information, the State recommends probation and leaves amount up to the Court. 15CM181 is DRI.
P-NC
COP filed, rights given
the deft waives right to JT
the State relies on comp for FB - defense stipulates to same
finding of guilt

BTC: guilty as above. PSI ordered  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 7, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
to consolidate

Ct 1: 961.41(3g)(e)-PCS/THC. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant  NOT consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances.   Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) to monitor - report to 524 S Main Street, Third Floor (262-632-1780).   No contact with the victim JLG (person, property, residence or family).   Defendant must live with his grandmother, Lula Reed at 1306 N. Wisconsin St, Racine, WI 53402. Defendant must go to school daily unless he has a doctor's excuse. May not be disruptiave in class, in the hallway or on school grounds. Must complete all assignments to the best of his intellecutal ability. Must follow all rules of grandmother's house. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

The Court hears bond motion as the Court's calendar cannot hear the bond motion in a timely manner. deft may live with his grandmother Lula Reed at 1306 N Wisconsin St, RW 03
defense asks that bond be converted to signature bond.

BTC: Bond may be converted to signature bond. Must live with grandmother at 1306 N. Wisconsin St. Must go to school daily unless has doctor's excuse, may not be disruptive in class, hallways or school grounds. Defendant must do all assignments to the best of his intellectual ability. Must follow all rules of grandmother's home.
